block.p: A tasting of Tuscan wines and hors d'oeuvres will be held in the gardens of the Dyckman Farmhouse Museum, 4881 Broadway (204th Street), tomorrow from 6:30 to 9 p.m. Tickets are $30 and will benefit the museum, which is Manhattan's only farmhouse and was built in 1784. There will be free shuttle-bus service from 64th Street and Fifth Avenue: (212) 304-9422.

A Taste of Chelsea, which benefits P.S. 11, will be held tomorrow from 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. in the Chelsea Market, 75 Ninth Avenue (15th Street). Food from establishments in the market and in the neighborhood will be available for tasting with a $25 ticket, which is good for five food and three wine tastings. Tickets will be sold at the door.

A tasting of Tuscan wines and hors d'oeuvres will be held in the gardens of the Dyckman Farmhouse Museum, 4881 Broadway (204th Street), tomorrow from 6:30 to 9 p.m. Tickets are $30 and will benefit the museum, which is Manhattan's only farmhouse and was built in 1784. There will be free shuttle-bus service from 64th Street and Fifth Avenue: (212) 304-9422.

A Taste of Chelsea, which benefits P.S. 11, will be held tomorrow from 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. in the Chelsea Market, 75 Ninth Avenue (15th Street). Food from establishments in the market and in the neighborhood will be available for tasting with a $25 ticket, which is good for five food and three wine tastings. Tickets will be sold at the door.

Taste of TriBeCa, to benefit arts programs in neighborhood elementary schools, will be held on Saturday from 11:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. on Duane Street between Greenwich and Hudson Streets. In case of rain, the event, which will have foods from more than 40 restaurants and shops, will be held in the Borough of Manhattan Community College, 199 Chambers Street (Greenwich Street). Tasting cards, $30 each for six tastings, will be sold at the entrance.
